result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Ryan Holmgren

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Cases 22CF89 and 22TR116 called together. Defendant Mark Ryan Holmgren in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Mark Ryan Holmgren.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases on for Status Conference. Defendant updates on 45 days programming, beginning 10/11/22.   Defense attorney updates the Court: def doing IDIP programming, asks for status conference 60 days out.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

3:21 PM Cases 22CF89 and 22TR116 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Ryan Holmgren in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Mark Ryan Holmgren. Case 22CF89 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information. Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
DA letter- State waiting to prosecute, cancelling court date for now.

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.
